span: Not Factory Unlocked ‚Äì Locked to AT&T, Bricked After Seller Error, No Resolution
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2025
review-text: I purchased this Galaxy S23 Ultra from Big Box LLC on June 17, 2025, based on the listing clearly stating the device was ‚ÄúFactory Unlocked.‚Äù That turned out to be false. üìÖ Timeline of What Happened: June 17 ‚Äì Order placed and shipped same day. June 18 ‚Äì Inserted SIM and discovered the phone was locked to AT&T. June 19‚Äì20 ‚Äì AT&T confirmed the device was under an unpaid installment plan and ineligible for unlocking. The seller provided an incorrect unlock code, which they later admitted was missing a digit. After multiple failed attempts, the device became MCK locked ‚Äî a high-level lock that makes the phone completely unusable. I spent over a week trying to get a valid unlock or MCK code from the seller. They kept stalling. June 28 ‚Äì Seller admitted they couldn‚Äôt obtain the MCK code and instructed me to return the phone. ‚ö†Ô∏è Why This Matters: A factory unlocked phone should never require an unlock code ‚Äî and certainly not end up MCK locked. I made 8 trips between T-Mobile and AT&T trying to resolve this. I lost 15+ hours of professional time, and the phone was bricked because of the seller‚Äôs incorrect information. After all of this, the only resolution was to return the phone ‚Äî which I did under protest, with the entire incident documented. I‚Äôm grateful that Amazon support has been helpful and professional, but buyers should be extremely cautious with this seller. A device tied to a financing plan should never be sold as ‚Äúfactory unlocked.‚Äù If your time and peace of mind are valuable, look elsewhere.

span: Worst PoS that didn't remove AT&T BS ...
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2025
review-text: Would give this 0 if possible, but it does gain 1 because it does mostly work in a T-Mobile dense metro area. Either the refurbishing failed to remove all AT&T crapware, or Samsung was incompetent and allowed some hidden AT&T configuration. This was supposed to be identical as unlocked, to the T-Mobile refurbished unlocked that I bought for my wife. There are many places within the area bounded by LA along I-10 to El Paso, up I-25 to Cheyenne; Barstow along I-40 to Oklahoma City then I-44 to Saint Louis, following up through Toledo to Ypsilanti, back west along I-80 to San Francisco, and down I-5 to Barstow, through Yuma toTucson. Along the western edge of Nevada from Las Vegas to Reno, Flagstaff up through Central Utah to Idaho. Both phones show identical configuration, and icons, but this POS refuses to connect to data services when the other one will. Voice support appears to be identical. As far as I can tell, the only difference between the phones is the original vendor, which should have been erased during the unlocking refurbishing. I waited to report because early-on I thought it might have been build-out because the other one was inconsistent. For the last 4000 miles, the other one works and this one fails.

span: BUYER BEWARE!!! Not as it says!!!!
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2025
review-text: BUYER BEWARE!!! phone looked fine. I took it to get it set up at spectrum. The guy says to me that it isn‚Äôt compatible with 5g network meaning the out parts from an older phone in it. Some of the apps came up with Canada as the location. There was cell bars with absolutely no sim cards in it or digitally in it. But it was transmitting. He said that‚Äôs how they can steal all your information once you switch to the new phone. Sounded pretty nefarious to me. He also informed me of amazons third party sellers for these refurbished phones and how they are so much cheaper bc of all the corners they cut refurbishing them. Stay away from anyone that isn‚Äôt an actual retailer of Samsung galaxy‚Äôs I‚Äôm currently checking out Best Buy and checking out Samsungs website for one. They are pricier for sure. But you know you are getting the phone you actually want that‚Äôs what it says it is. NOT 5G!!!!!! NOT U.S. VERSION! I‚Äôm so disappointed!

span: Worst renewed phone claiming to be in excellent condition.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2026
review-text: Barely good but is sold as excellent....Worst renewed phone ever....gets overheated when you charge it. The s pen is fake and does not connect. Comes in a plastic box with a USB to USBC cable...just don't waste your time on this one. Return is almost impossible to complete with the AI.....ITS NOT LETTING ME SELECT THAT THE ITEM IS DEFECTIVE

span: Foreign phone--no wifi calling in America
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2025
review-text: Do NOT BUY from them if you live in America. Their phones are foreign and you will not get wifi calling unless you flash the phone -which is risky and you know what you're doing. I made the mistake of purchasing the phone and I don't work in the summer SO once I needed it for work as well, it was past the 30 days and they won't do ANYTHING to assist me. Just said, oops-sorry. I'm extremely disappointed because in today's world we need wifi calling for service in most places.

span: Unresolved IMEI number.  Will not activate.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2025
review-text: The phone arrived and looked great. When I tried to activate it my carrier told me that the IMEI number was a bad number and let the phone could not be activated through my carrier. When I called Amazon, they told me that the IMEI number was not resolved when the phone was renewed and therefore it would not work with any carrier. I did get my money back.
